snippet: Prime Minister Recep Tayyip Erdogan’s measures appeared intended to revive a stalled peace process, but Kurdish leaders largely dismissed them as inadequate.
abstract: Turkish Prime Min Recep Tayyip Erdogan announces a package of measures that appear intended to revive the stalled peace process with the country's ethnic Kurds, who have fought a decades-long insurgency against the Turkish state; Kurdish leaders largely dismiss the measures as inadequate.
lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Recep Tayyip Erdogan’s measures appeared intended to revive a stalled peace process, but Kurdish leaders largely dismissed them as inadequate.

headline.main: Turkish Premier Announces Proposals Aimed at Kurds
headline.print_headline: Turkish Premier Announces Proposals Aimed at Kurds
